{"bundles":[{"updated_at":"2016-05-06T23:25:11Z","relay_groups":[],"permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_commands","id":"dbe0d9a6-da23-44b3-91cf-5da6d0bd7f16"},{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_groups","id":"16f0cf3e-6bea-4b46-a61e-eef4c1579625"},{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_permissions","id":"0aa36b0b-c876-4eb3-b184-736ae47cba34"},{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_relays","id":"39b2a104-9c33-46ce-8535-68bdb298e557"},{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_roles","id":"3f8ef177-0369-4b6a-ade6-0d12221ca437"},{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_users","id":"ec82fb65-478e-4639-828b-fe5af24b1be2"},{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_triggers","id":"2c07bade-50c8-4866-b3e5-ff0fa7f2b5c0"}],"name":"operable","inserted_at":"2016-05-06T23:25:11Z","id":"31611726-b5bc-4f66-93e6-af91e88ec874","enabled":true,"commands":[{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:alias allow","permissions":[],"id":"0c730b32-ef8e-4d24-b87c-900b15fecbbd","command":"operable:alias"}],"name":"alias","id":"839610dd-c6a4-4156-9bd6-db08ce05757d","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Manages aliases

## Subcommands
* new <alias-name> <alias-definition> -- creates a new alias visible to the creating user.
* mv <alias-name> <site | user>:[new-alias-name] -- moves aliases between user and site visibility. Optionally renames aliases.
* rm <alias-name> -- Removes aliases
* ls [pattern] -- Returns the list of aliases optionally filtered by pattern. Pattern support basic wildcards with '*'.

## Example

    @bot operable:alias new my-awesome-alias "echo "My Awesome Alias""
    > user:my-awesome-alias has been created

    @bot operable:alias mv my-awesome-alias site:awesome-alias
    > Moved user:my-awesome-alias to site:awesome-alias

    @bot operable:alias rm awesome-alias
    > Removed site:awesome-alias

    @bot operable:alias ls
    > Name: 'my-awesome-alias'
      Visibility: 'user'
      Pipeline: 'echo my-awesome-alias'

      Name: 'my-other-awesome-alias'
      Visibility: 'site'
      Pipeline: 'echo my-other-awesome-alias'
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:bundle must have operable:manage_commands","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_commands","id":"dbe0d9a6-da23-44b3-91cf-5da6d0bd7f16"}],"id":"106a76c8-9afe-424b-9027-d4bebb61d225","command":"operable:bundle"}],"name":"bundle","id":"16977932-f931-4e8f-a412-04c2be0ad8ee","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"
## Overview

Manipulate and interrogate command bundle status.

A bundle may be either `enabled` or `disabled`. If a bundle is
enabled, chat invocations of commands contained within the bundle
will be executed. If the bundle is disabled, on the other hand, no
such commands will be run.

Bundles may be enabled or disabled independently of whether or not
any Relays are currently _running_ the bundles. The status of a
bundle is managed centrally; when a Relay serving the bundle comes
online, the status of the bundle is respected. Thus a bundle may be
enabled, but not running on any Relays, just as it can be disabled,
but running on _every_ Relay.

This can be used to either quickly disable a bundle, or as the first
step in deleting a bundle from the bot.

Note that the `operable` bundle is a protected bundle;
this bundle is always enabled and is in fact embedded in the bot
itself. Core pieces of bot functionality would not work (including
this very command itself!) if this bundle were ever disabled (though
many functions would remain available via the REST API). As a
result, calling either of the mutator subcommands `enable` or
`disable` (see below) on the `operable` bundle is an
error.

## Subcommands

* `status`

        bundle status <bundle_name>

   Shows the current status of the bundle, whether `enabled` or
   `disabled`. Additionally shows which Relays (if any) are running
   the code for the bundle.

   The `enable` and `disable` subcommands (see below) also return
   this information.

   Can be called on any bundle, including `operable`.

* `enable`

        bundle enable <bundle_name>

  Enabling a bundle allows chat commands to be routed to it. Running
  this subcommand has no effect if a bundle is already enabled.

  Cannot be used on the `operable` bundle.

* `disable`

        bundle disable <bundle_name>

   Disabling a bundle prevents commands from being routed to it. The
   bundle is not uninstalled, and all custom rules remain
   intact. The bundle still exists, but commands in it will not be
   executed.

   A disabled bundle can be re-enabled using this the `enable`
   sub-command; see above.

   Running this subcommand has no effect if a bundle is already
   disabled.

   Cannot be used on the `operable` bundle.

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:echo allow","permissions":[],"id":"5230e954-56c3-4c31-bc45-ec9b6bfe22e6","command":"operable:echo"}],"name":"echo","id":"99ab27d8-276c-41bb-a9f0-bc85770f7293","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Repeats whatever it is passed.

## Example

    @bot operable:echo this is nifty
    > this if nifty

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:filter allow","permissions":[],"id":"f9501847-4879-43e7-813e-2380c076de15","command":"operable:filter"}],"name":"filter","id":"8127b95a-a643-400b-b93b-b2f7a3df3f80","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Filters a collection where the `path` equals the `matches`.
The `path` option is the key that you would like to focus on;
The `matches` option is the value that you are searching for.

## Example

    @bot operable:rules --list --for-command="operable:permissions" | operable:filter --path="rule" --matches="/manage_users/"
    > { "id": "91edb472-04cf-4bca-ba05-e51b63f26758",
        "rule": "operable:manage_users",
        "command": "operable:permissions" }

    @bot operable:seed --list --for-command="operable:permissions" | operable:filter --path="rule" --matches="/manage_users/"
    > { "id": "91edb472-04cf-4bca-ba05-e51b63f26758",
        "rule": "operable:manage_users",
        "command": "operable:permissions" }

    @bot operable:seed '[{"foo":{"bar.qux":{"baz":"stuff"}}}, {"foo": {"bar":{"baz":"me"}}}]' | operable:filter --path="foo.bar.baz""
    > [ {"foo": {"bar.qux": {"baz": "stuff"} } }, {"foo": {"bar": {"baz": "me"} } } ]

    @bot operable:seed '[{"foo":{"bar.qux":{"baz":"stuff"}}}, {"foo": {"bar":{"baz":"me"}}}]' | operable:filter --path="foo.\"bar.qux\".baz""
    > { "foo": {"bar.qux": {"baz": "stuff"} } }

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:group with option[create] == true must have operable:manage_groups","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_groups","id":"16f0cf3e-6bea-4b46-a61e-eef4c1579625"}],"id":"7db5e5b5-4378-4692-94dd-ff78d3f27a6b","command":"operable:group"},{"rule":"when command is operable:group with option[drop] == true must have operable:manage_groups","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_groups","id":"16f0cf3e-6bea-4b46-a61e-eef4c1579625"}],"id":"92cfdc05-a22c-49bd-9cdf-f54f8c522608","command":"operable:group"},{"rule":"when command is operable:group with option[list] == true must have operable:manage_groups","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_groups","id":"16f0cf3e-6bea-4b46-a61e-eef4c1579625"}],"id":"c6e8bd9d-62f9-4d17-a6f2-9cfa858207c6","command":"operable:group"},{"rule":"when command is operable:group with option[add] == true must have operable:manage_users","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_users","id":"ec82fb65-478e-4639-828b-fe5af24b1be2"}],"id":"89c92fb4-3da6-4267-ae5b-89354aedb2a2","command":"operable:group"},{"rule":"when command is operable:group with option[remove] == true must have operable:manage_users","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_users","id":"ec82fb65-478e-4639-828b-fe5af24b1be2"}],"id":"a2b80793-fa87-4f4e-a397-60ee78743e43","command":"operable:group"}],"name":"group","id":"82cf734d-a659-4c19-8e3f-8a38fbc88d4b","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to manage groups of users.

## Usage

    group --create <groupname>
    group --drop <groupname>
    group --add --user=<username> <groupname>
    group --remove --user=<username> <groupname>
    group --list

## Example

    @bot operable:group --create ops
    @bot operable:group --create engineering
    @bot operable:group --add --user=bob ops
    @bot operable:group --remove --user=bob ops
    @bot operable:group --drop ops
    @bot operable:group --list
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:help allow","permissions":[],"id":"a81fe215-f9d5-4aa9-bfb0-2cf7a81bdb61","command":"operable:help"}],"name":"help","id":"056f0319-ae20-468a-a221-7fb4e3b972dd","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Get help on all installed Cog bot commands.

## Example

    @bot operable:help - list all enabled commands
    @bot operable:help --disabled - list all disabled commands
    @bot operable:help --all - list all known commands, enabled and disabled
    @bot operable:help "operable:help" - list help for a specific command

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:max allow","permissions":[],"id":"27a00be3-6304-4b54-987b-ab99864c7fe4","command":"operable:max"}],"name":"max","id":"0d0f84ee-7f1b-4c94-b188-0413b754732a","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to determine the maximum value given a
list of inputs.

## Example

    @bot operable:max 49 9 2 2
    @bot operable:max 0.48 0.2 1.8 3548.4 0.078
    @bot operable:max "apple" "ball" "car" "zebra"
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:min allow","permissions":[],"id":"be6f1369-c3a2-4aa8-b4bf-eac1513bfc17","command":"operable:min"}],"name":"min","id":"0ccb9577-1e34-4616-8b9c-840ca894af18","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to determine the minimum value given a
list of inputs.

## Example

    @bot operable:min 49 9 2 2
    @bot operable:min 0.48 0.2 1.8 3548.4 0.078
    @bot operable:min "apple" "ball" "car" "zebra"
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:permissions with option[grant] == true must have operable:manage_roles","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_roles","id":"3f8ef177-0369-4b6a-ade6-0d12221ca437"}],"id":"daacc6f4-7c01-40fa-b7aa-17ec0e46ae06","command":"operable:permissions"},{"rule":"when command is operable:permissions with option[revoke] == true must have operable:manage_roles","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_roles","id":"3f8ef177-0369-4b6a-ade6-0d12221ca437"}],"id":"3bfad6f9-d3c6-4d06-83f4-b4af684a9495","command":"operable:permissions"},{"rule":"when command is operable:permissions with option[create] == true must have operable:manage_permissions","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_permissions","id":"0aa36b0b-c876-4eb3-b184-736ae47cba34"}],"id":"279f41a4-15e1-4a83-ac02-3b206d924af6","command":"operable:permissions"},{"rule":"when command is operable:permissions with option[delete] == true must have operable:manage_permissions","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_permissions","id":"0aa36b0b-c876-4eb3-b184-736ae47cba34"}],"id":"23be0e97-fd73-4c05-aadd-b54abf913f76","command":"operable:permissions"},{"rule":"when command is operable:permissions with option[list] == true must have operable:manage_permissions","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_permissions","id":"0aa36b0b-c876-4eb3-b184-736ae47cba34"}],"id":"9223a45e-f2bc-484c-b0f3-d60542d8f1c8","command":"operable:permissions"}],"name":"permissions","id":"23c47f85-ed75-4dff-9226-f88bd0ac2fc3","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Manipulate authorization permissions.

* Create permissions in the `site` namespace
* Delete permissions in the `site` namespace
* List all permissions in the system
* Grant and revoke permissions from roles.

## Format

    --list
    --create --permission=site:<name>
    --delete --permission=site:<name>
    --grant --permission=<namespace>:<permission> --role=<name>"
    --revoke --permission=<namespace>:<permission> --role=<name>"

## Example

    @bot operable:permissions --list
    @bot operable:permissions --create --permission=site:admin
    @bot operable:permissions --delete --permission=site:admin
    @bot operable:permissions --grant --role=dev --permission=site:write
    @bot operable:permissions --revoke --role=dev --permission=giphy:giphy

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:raw allow","permissions":[],"id":"527b513c-186f-4ae8-b2d2-41341b595b04","command":"operable:raw"}],"name":"raw","id":"bff4acea-83e4-48be-9af9-ab6a9ab79723","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Show the raw output of a command, exclusive of any templating.

Useful for seeing the difference between `multiple` and `once`
execution modes, as well as seeing which fields are available for
use in `bound` and `all` calling conventions.

Also useful as a debugging tool for command authors.

## Example

    @bot operable:echo foo | operable:raw
    > {
        "body": [
          "foo"
        ]
      }

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:relay must have operable:manage_relays","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_relays","id":"39b2a104-9c33-46ce-8535-68bdb298e557"}],"id":"f45b83a8-ad72-4535-919e-4b49217b5d5e","command":"operable:relay"}],"name":"relay","id":"5ffe4bf4-2671-4c6d-a138-09cd45b3838c","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Manages relays
Usage relay <subcommand> [flags]

Subcommands
* list -- Lists relays and their status
* update -- Update the name or description of a relay
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:relay-group must have operable:manage_relays","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_relays","id":"39b2a104-9c33-46ce-8535-68bdb298e557"}],"id":"b12af2df-1c18-4cda-bda1-4882e288be24","command":"operable:relay-group"}],"name":"relay-group","id":"49b4b69b-96cc-4c61-a529-2bb05b4b9869","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Manages relay groups
Usage relay-group <subcommand> [flags]

Subcommands
* info -- Get info about one or more relay groups
* create -- Creates a relay group
* rename -- Renames a relay group
* delete -- Deletes a relay group
* add -- Adds relays to relay groups
* remove -- Remove relays from relay groups
* assign -- Assigns bundles to relay groups
* unassign -- Un-assigns bundles from relay groups
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:role with option[drop] == true must have operable:manage_roles","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_roles","id":"3f8ef177-0369-4b6a-ade6-0d12221ca437"}],"id":"140c7b44-a9d2-403e-bc7b-b6f81d506c68","command":"operable:role"},{"rule":"when command is operable:role with option[list] == true must have operable:manage_roles","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_roles","id":"3f8ef177-0369-4b6a-ade6-0d12221ca437"}],"id":"0707a53f-f23c-4b8d-aaf4-a32a467d73b9","command":"operable:role"},{"rule":"when command is operable:role with option[grant] == true must have operable:manage_groups","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_groups","id":"16f0cf3e-6bea-4b46-a61e-eef4c1579625"}],"id":"eaac6177-fcea-4ee0-be0c-d3dc4ee57d56","command":"operable:role"},{"rule":"when command is operable:role with option[revoke] == true must have operable:manage_groups","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_groups","id":"16f0cf3e-6bea-4b46-a61e-eef4c1579625"}],"id":"2beaf161-a517-4ff1-9777-73301f16bd29","command":"operable:role"},{"rule":"when command is operable:role with option[create] == true must have operable:manage_roles","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_roles","id":"3f8ef177-0369-4b6a-ade6-0d12221ca437"}],"id":"b5044621-ec50-469a-a155-ffaf52a2d198","command":"operable:role"}],"name":"role","id":"eba28ba4-810a-4184-abf2-84526329a7c6","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to manage roles.

## Usage

    role --create <rolename>
    role --drop <rolename>
    role --grant --group=<groupname> <rolename>
    role --revoke --group=<groupname> <rolename>
    role --list

## Example

    @bot operable:role --create deployment
    @bot operable:role --grant --group=ops deployment
    @bot operable:role --revoke --group=ops deployment
    @bot operable:role --drop deployment
    @bot operable:role --list
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:rules must have operable:manage_commands","permissions":[{"namespace":"operable","name":"manage_commands","id":"dbe0d9a6-da23-44b3-91cf-5da6d0bd7f16"}],"id":"99255283-6569-4d7c-95c8-042e7dc9d2e9","command":"operable:rules"}],"name":"rules","id":"c3b24946-cd7e-4c68-ae3f-090b57334118","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to manage rules for commands.

## Format

    rules --add "when command is <full_command_name> must have <namespace>:<permission>"
    rules --add --for-command=<full_command_name> --permission=<namespace>:<permission>
    rules --list --for-command=<full_command_name>
    rules --drop --for-command=<full_command_name>
    rules --drop --id=<rule_id>

## Example

    @bot operable:rules --add "when command is operable:ec2-terminate must have operable:ec2"
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:seed allow","permissions":[],"id":"3c58a93d-1d19-436d-9bc6-0e9528d90d20","command":"operable:seed"}],"name":"seed","id":"400812db-835a-4bc0-b8fe-2ccd9a0a35b0","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Seed a pipeline with arbitrary data.

Accepts a single string argument, which must be valid JSON for
either a map or a list of maps.

Though some values may be able to be typed without enclosing quotes,
it is highly recommended to single-quote your entire string.

Best used for debugging and experimentation.

## Example

    !seed '{"thing":"stuff"}' | echo $thing
    > stuff

    !seed '[{"thing":"stuff"},{"thing":"more stuff"}]' | echo $thing
    > stuff
    > more stuff

"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:sleep allow","permissions":[],"id":"3d2e7f35-0a99-4073-86b4-3be15194f2b2","command":"operable:sleep"}],"name":"sleep","id":"a568005b-3961-4509-8690-18700478b263","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Sleeps for the provided number of seconds and emits the exact
input passed in.

## Usage

  sleep <duration>

## Examples

  @cog sleep 2400 | echo "Lasagna is done cooking!" > me
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:sort allow","permissions":[],"id":"91bfd0b2-35c3-4b7e-b59e-2a6afb0ff810","command":"operable:sort"}],"name":"sort","id":"2c83fe95-71a9-40e6-842f-f2f0eccfad8c","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Sorts the given list of input in ascending order by default.

## Usage

  sort [flags] [fields...]

  Fields are used to pick which values to sort by. If two keys have the same
  value the values of the next key are compared and so on. If no fields are
  provided, items are intellegently sorted based on their contents.

## Flags

  -a, --asc   sort in ascending order
  -d, --desc  sort in descending order

## Examples
  @cog seed '[{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}, {"a": 2}]' | sort
  > [{"a": 1}, {"a": 2}, {"a": 3}]

  @cog seed '[{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}, {"a": 2}]' | sort --desc
  > [{"a": 3}, {"a": 2}, {"a": 1}]

  @cog seed '[{"a": 3, "b": 4}, {"a": 1, "b": 4}, {"a": 2, "b": 6}]' | sort b a
  > [{"a": 1, "b": 4}, {"a: 3, "b": 4}, {"a": 2, "b": 6}]
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:sum allow","permissions":[],"id":"d0546f95-dc41-45e8-8164-195b1a5a44ea","command":"operable:sum"}],"name":"sum","id":"126fb687-afc5-4e80-b443-9a72cde7b963","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to sum together a list of numbers

## Example

    @bot operable:sum 2 2
    @bot operable:sum 2 "-9"
    @bot operable:sum 2 24 57 3.7 226.78
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:table allow","permissions":[],"id":"9c9578fc-8784-46e5-b96b-d65f6c454f21","command":"operable:table"}],"name":"table","id":"ac0f2229-fb18-4b8d-97d1-ecb47e6d0e21","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Converts the given list into a table of columns with headers.

## Usage

  table [columns...]

  Columns specify the keys in the json to include in the table;
  these column names are also used as headers. If no columns are
  provided, the columns will be made up of all existing keys.

## Examples

  @cog seed '[{"pizza": "cheese", "price": "$10"}, {"pizza": "peperoni", "price": "$12"}]' | table
  > pizza     price
    cheese    $10
    peperoni  $12

  @cog seed '[{"pizza": "cheese", "price": "$10"}, {"pizza": "peperoni", "price": "$12"}]' | table pizza
  > pizza   
    cheese  
    peperoni

  @cog seed '[{"pizza": "cheese", "price": "$10"}, {"pizza": "peperoni", "price": "$12"}]' | table price pizza
  > price  pizza
    $10    cheese
    $12    peperoni
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:unique allow","permissions":[],"id":"69b19ff5-45c7-4530-9b80-f3a0a95df999","command":"operable:unique"}],"name":"unique","id":"4f95cb7d-9f44-4036-b8e7-47e834dc38fd","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Removes all duplicate values from the given input.

## Usage

  unique

## Examples

  @cog seed '[{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}, {"a": 1}]' | unique
  > [{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}]
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:wc allow","permissions":[],"id":"50b909e4-76e5-494e-aa15-2cb484d7e438","command":"operable:wc"}],"name":"wc","id":"5c305d7f-d676-4343-b1b3-dd1abf780f0c","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"This command allows the user to count the number of words or lines in the input string.

    wc [--words | --lines]  <input string>

## Example

    > @bot wc --words "Hey, what will we do today?"
    > @bot wc --lines "From time to time
    The clouds give rest
    To the moon-beholders."
"},{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is operable:which allow","permissions":[],"id":"b777455d-4ae1-48fa-8a2b-45d31e93c4ec","command":"operable:which"}],"name":"which","id":"ed32935a-aebb-4cee-983c-534dfec4084c","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":"Determine whether a given input is a command or an alias. Returns the type of
input and it's bundle or visibility. In the case of aliases it also returns
the aliased command string. This command is only useful non fully qualified
commands or aliases. Fully qualified commands or aliases will return no match.

Note: If a command is shadowed, it has an alias with the same name, the alias
will be returned.

## Example

    @bot operable:which my-awesome-alias
    > alias - user:my-awesome-alias -> "echo my awesome alias"

    @bot operable:which an-awesome-command
    > command - operable:an-awesome-command

    @bot operable:which not-anything
    > No matching commands or aliases.
"}]},{"updated_at":"2016-05-06T23:25:22Z","relay_groups":[],"permissions":[],"name":"testfoo","inserted_at":"2016-05-06T23:25:22Z","id":"7cc4b1d0-3cfa-48e4-903a-e6b658ba599d","enabled":false,"commands":[{"rules":[{"rule":"when command is testfoo:bar allow","permissions":[],"id":"f5bf14bf-557b-4c63-b50d-ca109e5d0a1b","command":"testfoo:bar"}],"name":"bar","id":"49d7bfcc-ed9a-4c5f-9547-f74ad475c118","execution":"multiple","enforcing":true,"documentation":null}]}]}
